sections.FINDINGS:
Reference ranges:
Significant stenosis -
Diameter stenosis > 70%
PSV > 230 cm/s
EDV > 100 cm/s
Normal -
PSV < 125 cm/s
[Abbreviations]
CCA = Common carotid artery
ICA = Internal carotid artery
ECA = External carotid artery
[Right Carotid System]
CCA peak systolic velocity (cm/s)
ICA peak systolic velocity (cm/s)
ICA/CCA peak systolic velocity ratio
ICA peak end-diastolic velocity (cm/s)
[Left  Carotid System]
CCA peak systolic velocity (cm/s)
ICA peak systolic velocity (cm/s)
ICA/CCA peak systolic velocity ratio
ICA peak end-diastolic velocity (cm/s)
Cephalic flow is observed in bilateral external carotid and vertebral arteries.
Doppler USG shows no haemodynamically significant stenosis.
No demonstrable luminal plaque is seen in bilateral common carotid arteries and internal carotid arteries.
__ Mild to moderate atheromatous change noted at left CCA, with deposition of partially calcified plaques. Calcified plaques are seen at left carotid bifurcation, extending to proximal end of left ICA. Diameter stenosis at left CCA, left carotid birfucation and cervical portion of left ICA is less than 40%.
No / Mild intimal thickening is seen at bilateral distal CCA, measuring up to __ cm at right CCA and __ cm at left CCA
sections.COMMENTS: Diffuse mild intimal thickening and atherosclerotic plagues at both bulbs, with no haemodynamically carotid stenosis detected (according to NASCET guidelines).

sections.COMMENTS:
The intimal thickness of left and right common carotid arteries measure __ mm and __ mm respectively, __  percentile IMT values standardized for age and gender.
Findings are indicative of an __increased / unchanged cardiovascular risk, according to the American Society of Echography Consensus Statement.
Carotid IMT values greater than or equal to 75th percentile are considered high and indicative of increased CVD risk.
Values in the 25th to 75th percentile are considered average and indicative of unchanged CVD risk.
Values less than or equal to 25th percentile are considered lower CVD risk.

sections.FINDINGS:

name: ULTRASOUND OF URINARY SYSTEM (KIDNEYS AND URINARY BLADDER)

sections.FINDINGS:
Renal sizes, outlines and parenchymal echotexture are normal.
Corticomedullary differentiation is preserved.
Collecting systems are not dilated.
No space occupying lesion or renal stone is seen in the kidneys.
Urinary bladder shows fair distension.
No bladder stone, focal mural thickening or intra-vesical space occupying lesion is noted.
sections.COMMENTS: No focal lesion seen in the kidneys and urinary bladder.

sections.FINDINGS:
Left kidney measures 9.47cm in length. Moderate left/right hydronephrosis and proximal left hydroureter are noted. Cortical thinning is seen in the left kidney, suggestive of a long-standing process. The distal portion of the left ureter is obscured. No definite renal or ureteric stone is seen.
Right kidney is normal in size and measures 11.1cm in length. Parenchymal echotexture is normal. Corticomedullary differentiation is preserved. Collecting systems are not dilated.
No space occupying lesion or renal stone is seen.
sections.COMMENTS: Moderate left/right hydronephrosis and proximal hydroureter with cortical thinning. Correlation with previous investigation findings (if any) +/- further evaluation is suggested.

name: DOPPLER ULTRASOUND OF **LEFT LOWER LIMB VEINS

sections.FINDINGS:
The **left common femoral, superficial femoral, popliteal, posterior tibial, peroneal and anterior tibial veins are patent and are fully compressible.
No abnormal internal echoes are seen.
The veins show normal Doppler signals and spectral variation with augmentation and respiration.
sections.COMMENTS: No sonographic evidence of deep vein thrombosis from **left common femoral vein down to calf veins.

name: DOPPLER ULTRASOUND FOR RIGHT LOWER LIMB VENOUS INCOMPETENCE

sections.FINDINGS:
The right common femoral, superficial femoral and popliteal veins are patent and are fully compressible. No abnormal internal echoes are seen.
The veins show normal Doppler signals and spectral variation with augmentation and respiration.
The great saphenous vein (from SFJ down to ankle level) and the short saphenous vein (from popliteal level down to ankle level ) shows normal Doppler signal with no sonographic evidence of venous incompetence or reflux upon standing Valsalva maneuver and augmentation.
sections.COMMENTS: No sonographic evidence of venous incompetence in the right superficial and deep vein systems.

sections.FINDINGS:
Renal sizes, outlines and parenchymal echotexture are normal.
The right and left kidneys measure __ cm and __ cm respectively.
Corticomedullary differentiation is preserved.
Collecting systems are not dilated.
No space occupying lesion or renal stone is seen in the kidneys.
Color and spectral Doppler interrogation of the renal arteries was performed utilizing both the indirect method, evaluating the distal renal arteries just proximal to the renal hila bilaterally and the intrarenal arteries, and the direct method, evaluating main renal artery velocities at the origins off the aorta.   The systolic acceleration is normal bilaterally, greater than 3m/s/s.  The resistance index is within normal limits, between ___ to ___ bilaterally.  Peak velocities within the origins of the renal arteries are in the normal range, measuring ___ cm/s on the right and ___ cm/s on the left.  Peak velocity within the abdominal aorta measures approximately 100cm/s.  Normal main renal venous flow was seen bilaterally.
sections.COMMENTS: No evidence of renal artery stenosis utilizing both indirect and direct methods of renal artery Doppler interrogation.

sections.PROCEDURE:
With reference to prior ultrasound dated _, the target _ thyroid nodule is identified, measuring _ cm.
The potential risks of the procedure have been explained to the patient and the patient consented for the procedure.
The procedure is performed under aseptic technique and local anaesthesia (2% Xylocaine) using a 21G hypodermic needle. A total of 3 passes are made. Specimen is sent for cytology.
Procedure is uneventful.  Nil immediate complication.
sections.SUMMARY:
Ultrasound-guided FNA of thyroid nodule performed, uneventful.
